00050 uvm_phase_controller* uvm_phase_controller::m_phase_controller = 0;
00051 
00052 uvm_phase_controller* uvm_phase_controller::get_phase_controller() 
00053 {
00054     if (m_phase_controller == 0) {
00055         m_phase_controller = new uvm_phase_controller();
00056     }
00057     return m_phase_controller;
00058 }
00059 
00060 uvm_phase_controller::uvm_phase_controller() 
00061 {
00062     sc_time max_time; // the time at which sc_start() returns
00063     sc_time smallest_time = sc_get_time_resolution();
00064 
00065 
00066     m_stop_mode  = UVM_SC_STOP;
00067     m_stop_reason= UVM_STOP_REASON_DURATION_COMPLETE;
00068 
00069 
00070     max_time = SC_MAX_TIME;
00071 
00072     // TODO - Do we need to reduce the time here?  Post run is run after sc_stop anyway...
00073     // Original comment:
00074     // make the UVM timeouts be slightly less than when sc_start() returns
00075     // such that UVM is able to end the run phase
00076     m_global_timeout = max_time - smallest_time;
00077     m_duration = SC_MAX_TIME; 
00078 
00079 
00080     // Setup default common & uvm schedules (always present)
00081     m_pcommon_schedule = get_uvm_common_schedule();
00082     m_schedules.push_back(m_pcommon_schedule);
00083 
00084     m_puvm_schedule    = get_uvm_schedule();
00085     m_schedules.push_back(m_puvm_schedule);
00086 
00087 }
00088  
00089 uvm_phase_controller::~uvm_phase_controller() {
00090 }

00092 
00093 bool uvm_phase_controller::add_schedule(uvm_schedule* user_schedule) 
00094 {
00095     // Note:  User schedule - only the 'do_run' method will be called
00096     //                      - hence only runtime phases will be executed
00097 
00098     std::string name = user_schedule->get_name();
00099 
00100     // Check that schedule name does not conflict with existing schedules (first come, first serve)
00101     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_schedules.size(); i++)
00102     {
00103         if (m_schedules[i]->get_name().compare(name) == 0)
00104             return false; 
00105     }
00106 
00107     // Valid user schedule - add to schedule vector
00108     m_schedules.push_back(user_schedule);
00109     return true;
00110 }
00111 
00112 const std::vector<uvm_schedule*> uvm_phase_controller::get_schedules(void) {
00113     return m_schedules;
00114 }
00115 
00116 uvm_schedule* uvm_phase_controller::get_schedule_by_name(std::string name) 
00117 {
00118     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_schedules.size(); i++)
00119     {
00120         if (m_schedules[i]->get_name().compare(name) == 0)
00121             return m_schedules[i];
00122     }
00123     return NULL;
00124 }

00127 //-------------------------------
00128 // Main Phase controller methods

00130 
00131 stop_reason_enum uvm_phase_controller::start(void) 
00132 {
00133     // Execute PRE_RUN common schedule - serially
00134     do_prerun();
00135 
00136     // Schedule RUN schedules
00137     do_run();
00138 
00139     // Start the simulation - execute spawned runtime schedules threads
00140     // sc_simcontext * context = sc_get_curr_simcontext();
00141     // context->co_simulate(m_duration);
00142     try
00143     {
00144         QUASI_STATIC_PREPARE_TO_SIMULATE();
00145         UVM_SC_CO_SIMULATE(m_duration);
00146     }
00147     catch(int)
00148     {
00149         m_stop_reason = UVM_STOP_REASON_RUN_PHASE_FATAL;
00150     }
00151 
00152     print_stop_reason(m_stop_reason);
00153 
00154 
00155     // Execute POST_RUN common schedule - serially
00156     do_postrun();
00157 
00158     return m_stop_reason;
00159 
00160 }
00161 
00162 void uvm_phase_controller::do_prerun(void) {
00163 
00164     std::string          phase_name;
00165     std::ostringstream   outmsg;
00166     uvm_phase_state state;
00167     uvm_phase *     pcurrent_phase = m_pcommon_schedule->get_current_phase();
00168 
00169     // Note:  Get all tops as pure sc_modules, in case they have uvm_comp children
00170     std::vector<sc_core::sc_module *> all_tops = uvm_get_tops();
00171     //int result;
00172 
00173 
00174     if (pcurrent_phase == NULL)
00175     {
00176         SC_REPORT_FATAL(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_PHASE_UNSPECIFIED,"");
00177         exit(1);
00178     }
00179     if(pcurrent_phase->get_phase_type() != UVM_PRERUN_PHASE) 
00180     {
00181         outmsg << pcurrent_phase->get_name() << endl;
00182         SC_REPORT_FATAL(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_PHASE_TYPE,outmsg.str().c_str());
00183         exit(1);
00184     }
00185 
00186     //  Loop over pre-run phases
00187     while((pcurrent_phase != NULL) &&(pcurrent_phase->get_phase_type() == UVM_PRERUN_PHASE))
00188     {
00189         phase_name = pcurrent_phase->get_name();
00190         state = pcurrent_phase->get_phase_state();
00191 
00192         // Loop over states per phase
00193         while(state != UVM_PHASE_DONE)
00194         {
00195             // For SystemC phases, call once per phase/state
00196             // TODO - check 'result' for errors (1=OK, 0=error)
00197             //result = m_pcommon_schedule->execute_quasi_static_phase(phase_name, state); 
00198             m_pcommon_schedule->execute_quasi_static_phase(phase_name, state); 
00199 
00200             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < all_tops.size(); i++)
00201             {
00202                m_pcommon_schedule->execute_nonruntime_phase(all_tops[i]);  // setting the phase state
00203                // TODO:  Any results to check here?
00204             }
00205             state = m_pcommon_schedule->update_phase_state();
00206         }
00207         pcurrent_phase = m_pcommon_schedule->get_current_phase();
00208     }
00209 
00210     // TODO - check for fatal errors here (try/catch?)
00211     //        Note:  Needs to work in ML as well...
00212 }
00213 
00214 void uvm_phase_controller::do_run(void) 
00215 {
00216 
00217     sc_process_handle run_handle;
00218     sc_spawn_options o;
00219     
00220     MARK_THREAD_INVISIBLE(o);
00221 
00222     // spawn thread that will wait for m_global_timeout to expire
00223     sc_spawn(sc_bind(&uvm_phase_controller::wait_for_global_timeout, this),
00224             "uvm_wait_for_global_timeout",
00225             &o
00226     );
00227 
00228     // spawn UVM runtime schedules
00229     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_schedules.size(); i++)
00230     {
00231         run_handle = sc_spawn(sc_bind(&uvm_schedule::do_run, m_schedules[i]));
00232         m_join_run.add_process(run_handle);
00233     }
00234 
00235     // spawn thread that will wait for active runtime schedules to complete
00236     sc_spawn(sc_bind(&uvm_phase_controller::wait_for_run_phases, this),
00237             "uvm_wait_for_run_phases",
00238             &o
00239     );
00240 
00241     // TODO - spawn check for runtime fatal errors here (try/catch?)
00242     //        Note:  Needs to work in ML as well...
00243 }
00244 
00245 
00246 void uvm_phase_controller::do_postrun(void) 
00247 {
00248     std::string     phase_name;
00249     std::ostringstream   outmsg;
00250     uvm_phase_state state;
00251     puvm_phase      pcurrent_phase = m_pcommon_schedule->get_current_phase();
00252 
00253     // Note:  Get all tops including pure sc_modules, in case they have uvm_comp children
00254     std::vector<sc_core::sc_module *> all_tops = uvm_get_tops();
00255 
00256 
00257     // Set common schedule to first postrun phase (ie. 'extract')
00258     // Note:  set to the first postrun phase after 'run' phase;
00259     //        accounts for cases where run phase terminates early due to timeout or errors 
00260     pcurrent_phase = m_pcommon_schedule->get_phase("extract");      // first postrun phase after run
00261 
00262     if (pcurrent_phase == NULL)
00263     {
00264         SC_REPORT_INFO(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_POST_RUN_NONE,"");
00265         return;     // No post-run schedules to execute
00266     }
00267     if(pcurrent_phase->get_phase_type() != UVM_POSTRUN_PHASE) 
00268     {
00269         outmsg << pcurrent_phase->get_name() << endl;
00270         SC_REPORT_FATAL(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_PHASE_TYPE,outmsg.str().c_str());
00271         exit(1);
00272     }
00273     m_pcommon_schedule->set_current_phase(pcurrent_phase);
00274 
00275 
00276     //  Loop over post-run phases
00277     while((pcurrent_phase != NULL) &&(pcurrent_phase->get_phase_type() == UVM_POSTRUN_PHASE))
00278     {
00279         phase_name = pcurrent_phase->get_name();
00280         state = pcurrent_phase->get_phase_state();
00281 
00282         while(state != UVM_PHASE_DONE)
00283         {
00284             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < all_tops.size(); i++)
00285             {
00286                m_pcommon_schedule->execute_nonruntime_phase(all_tops[i]);  // setting the phase state
00287                // TODO:  Any results to check here?
00288             }
00289             state = m_pcommon_schedule->update_phase_state();
00290         }
00291         pcurrent_phase = m_pcommon_schedule->get_current_phase();
00292     }
00293 
00294     // TODO - check for fatal errors here (try/catch?)
00295     //        Note:  Needs to work in ML as well...
00296 }

00327 //------------------------
00328 // Spawned Methods

00330 
00331 void uvm_phase_controller::wait_for_global_timeout() {
00332   
00333     // Since this thread may be spawned slightly later, get accurate timeout based on spawn time
00334     sc_time tdur = m_global_timeout - sc_time_stamp();
00335 
00336     wait(tdur);
00337 
00338     // global timeout has expired => run phase has ended
00339     SC_REPORT_WARNING(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_GLOBAL_TIMEOUT,"");
00340     stop_run(UVM_STOP_REASON_GLOBAL_TIMEOUT);
00341 }
00342 
00343 void uvm_phase_controller::wait_for_run_phases() 
00344 {
00345     // wait for all spawned runtime schedules to complete their run phases
00346     if (m_join_run.process_count() > 0) {
00347         m_join_run.wait();
00348     }
00349 
00350     // all stop tasks have returned => end run phase
00351     stop_run(UVM_STOP_REASON_PHASE_COMPLETE);
00352 }
00353 
00354 void uvm_phase_controller::stop_run(stop_reason_enum reason) 
00355 {
00356     static bool invoked = false; 
00357 
00358     if (!invoked) {
00359         invoked = true;
00360     } else {
00361         // stop_run() has already been called;
00362         // this can happen if uvm_stop_request has been called 
00363         // but the stop processes do not all return; then global_timeout and
00364         // stop_timeout will expire at same time, and both will call 
00365         // stop_run() 
00366         return;
00367     }
00368 
00369     m_stop_reason = reason;
00370     if (m_stop_mode == UVM_SC_STOP) {
00371         sc_stop();
00372     }
00373 }
00374 
00375 //------------------------
00376 // Helper Methods
00377 //------------------------
00378 
00379 void uvm_phase_controller::print_stop_reason(stop_reason_enum reason)
00380 {
00381     switch(m_stop_reason)
00382     {
00383         case UVM_STOP_REASON_DURATION_COMPLETE:
00384             SC_REPORT_INFO(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_STOP_DURATION,"");
00385             break;
00386         case UVM_STOP_REASON_GLOBAL_TIMEOUT:
00387             SC_REPORT_INFO(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_STOP_GLOBAL_TIMEOUT,"");
00388             break;
00389         case UVM_STOP_REASON_PHASE_COMPLETE:
00390             SC_REPORT_INFO(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_STOP_PHASE_COMPLETE,"");
00391             break;
00392         case UVM_STOP_REASON_USER_REQUEST:
00393             SC_REPORT_INFO(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_STOP_USER_REQUEST,"");
00394             break;
00395         case UVM_STOP_REASON_PRERUN_PHASE_FATAL:
00396             SC_REPORT_INFO(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_STOP_PRERUN_PHASE_FATAL,"");
00397             break;
00398         case UVM_STOP_REASON_POSTRUN_PHASE_FATAL:
00399             SC_REPORT_INFO(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_STOP_POSTRUN_PHASE_FATAL,"");
00400             break;
00401         case UVM_STOP_REASON_RUN_PHASE_FATAL:
00402             SC_REPORT_INFO(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_STOP_RUN_PHASE_FATAL,"");
00403             break;
00404         case UVM_STOP_REASON_MAX_ERRORS:
00405             SC_REPORT_INFO(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_STOP_MAX_ERRORS,"");
00406             break;
00407         default:
00408             SC_REPORT_INFO(UVM_PHASE_CTRL_STOP_UNKNOWN,"");
00409             break;
00410     };
00411 
00412     return;
00413 }
